study_metadata.inclusion_key: BMI 25–30 kg/m², age 50–80, no diabetes, no severe untreated medical, neurological, or psychiatric disease
study_metadata.exclusion_key: diabetes mellitus type 2, severe untreated medical, neurological, or psychiatric disease, daily alcohol >50 g, cigarettes >10/day, coffee >6 cups/day, non‑German speaking

evidence.snippet: resveratrol led to significant decreases in glycated hemoglobin (HbA1c) compared with placebo (all p < 0.05).
Subjects received 200 mg of resveratrol and 320 mg of quercetin daily for 26 weeks; placebo capsules contained sunflower oil.
Twenty‑three healthy overweight older adults completed 26 weeks of resveratrol intake (200 mg/d) and were pairwise matched to 23 placebo participants.

comment_detailed: I searched the abstract, methods, and results for glycemic outcomes. The study reports a significant decrease in HbA1c but provides no numeric values, standard deviations, or effect sizes. Consequently, baseline and follow‑up means, SDs, and change statistics are unknown, and no effect estimate can be calculated. Risk‑of‑bias domains are not described. Full tables or supplementary data would provide the missing numeric information needed for quantitative synthesis.
